item.title: Poor Waste Collection Service, 4th July
item.description:
The scheduled waste collection was missed for over a week, which resulted in bins overflowing and waste accumulating around the collection points. When the collection was finally carried out, the service was incomplete and careless.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Square, Hackney, London

item.title: I found a dead fox in my garden this morning., 4th July
item.description:
I have double bagged the dead carcass in accordance with the instructions on the Bromley LAA website. I have left this at the front of my property (by a large skip) and I understand you will arrange for it to be collected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, London

item.title: Household rubbish being dumped by bus stop bins, 4th July
item.description:
Houses of multiple occupancy (HMO) do not recycle their house hold rubbish properly, bins are not therefore emptied by council bin men. They then dump the rubbish by bus stop bin and foxes the rip open the bags and spread rubbish all over the area, including my property. 138 Swingate lane. Solution : dustman to identify households that do not recycle their house rubbish, if an HMO then the council to fine the landlord.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swingate Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass all across pavement (dangerous), 4th July
item.description:
There is a large amount of broken glass all across this stretch of pavement on Parish Lane (near no.62). Lots of school kids walk along here, as well as the risk to dogs' paws etc. please can it be cleared up asap. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Street cleaning - Dead animal on street

item.title: Broken pavements, 4th July
item.description:
The pavement along the front of the bungalows and around Pippenhall estate are in bad condition. I am always twisting my ankles up to the condition of the pavements. Please fix them for safety reasons. It is also hard trying to use my mobility scooter on them. Cars also park up on the pavements and some on the communal open gardens on the estate and in front of the bungalows. This blocks the pavements for walking on, then we have to walk in the Road. Very hard for residents using simmer frames, crutches and mobility scooters. The pavements are meant to be for walking on and the road for cars!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13-18, Southend Close, Avery Hill, Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wilton Estate Communal Bin Area, 4th July
item.description:
This issue has been ongoing for over six months. It needs to be properly addressed, rather than just sending someone for a one-time clean-up, it's a recurring problem. Also, there is always a recycling bin facing the wrong way and not be able to used.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
